newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Martinair to boost Kenyan freighter service.
newsitem.headline: Martinair to boost Kenyan freighter service.

text.p: Martinair NV is to increase the number of freighter flights between Schiphol and Nairobi to four weekly from the previous single flight, airline spokesman Udo Buys said.
The airline -- which is 50 percent owned by KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV -- will add the new flights to Martinair's winter schedule, starting October 1, he added.

Demand from shippers importing flowers from Kenya to Europe using Amsterdam's Schiphol airport in the Netherlands as a transhipment point, has persuaded the airline to launch the new services, he said. He added that Martinair is confident it will be able to fill the freighters on the ourward bound route.
The airline is to fly its McDonnell Douglas MD-11 aircraft on the route, which is already attracting forwarding bookings, Buys said.
Martinair launched its first Kenyan freight schedule in January this year. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
